head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Albany: Bloomberg Aide Urges Judicial Overhaul

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Albany: Bloomberg Aide Urges Judicial Overhaul
hedline.hl2: Albany: Bloomberg Aide Urges Judicial Overhaul

body.head.byline: By SEWELL CHAN; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: New York City Corporation Counsel Michael A Cardozo urges quick reform of state's judicial selection process at Senate hearing; Cardozo suggests changes to nominating conventions rather than open primaries in order to comply with 2006 federal court ruling that found nominating system unconstitutional (S)

block.p: Citing an ''unprecedented'' crisis of confidence in the state's judiciary, the New York City corporation counsel, Michael A. Cardozo, yesterday urged quick reform of the state's judicial selection process at a State Senate hearing. Last year, a federal appeals court found that the nominating system for electing State Supreme Court justices was unconstitutional, and imposed an interim process of direct primary elections. Mr. Cardozo, representing Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, suggested changes to the nominating conventions rather than the use of open primaries in choosing judicial candidates. He also urged that independent commissions be used to weigh Supreme Court candidates' qualifications.
